page.title: 12LOCAL HISTORY/ EDUCATION
page.content: Clipston School 1900 The village children all went to Clipston School, where there was a very strict headmaster named Mr. Wale They all wore a type of uniform comprising of lace up boots, leggins, which we now call gaiters, and the girls wore a white apron over their dresses to keep them clean. They all had to attend school six days a week, Monday to Saturday, from 9 o'clock to 4 o'clock each day. At 14 they left school, unless their family could afford to continue their education. In 1900 the present school building only housed the boys. The girls were taught, alongside the infants in the building that is now the village hall. The cane was an acceptable form of punishment for naughty children in those days.
